title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message:
hello, i have Macbook pro 820-4924-a that come dead..no water damage, its said that after he connect the mac to projector with HDMI its start to make problem, and after few days it was dead..
i was notice that PP5V_S3 5V sometimes have and sometimes disappear...i was replace also the charging connector and the same...any idea?

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message: Which voltages appear on the board?

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message:
Ppbus_3gh - 12.5v
pp5v_s5 - 5v
pp3v42_3gh -3.4v
PP3V3_S4 -0V
PP5V_S4 - 0V

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message:
Do you get 3V3_SUS?
Post PM_BATLOW_L, PM_RSMRST_L and PM_DSW_PWRGD and PCH_DSWVRMEN.
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L.
Did you try to start in SMC bypass mode?

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message:
3V3_SUS - 3.2V
PM_BATLOW_L - 0V( R1410- ONE SIDE 3.4V FROM 3V3_S5)
PM_RSMRST_L - 3V
PM_DSW_PWRGD - 3.4V
PCH_DSWVRMEN - 2.4V
SMC_ONOFF_L - 3.4V
PM_PWRBTN_L - 3.4V stable 

i was try SMC baypass dont do nothing..

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message:
"PM_BATLOW_L - 0V"
PCH cannot start power on sequence in this mode.
Do you have original Magsafe 2 60/85W charger???

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message: you right....it was 45w i didnt notice...now is 3.3v

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message: small update.. i was try SMC Baypass again, it didn't succeed, but suddenly the fan start working full speed for 5 second and stop until i push the power button again...i was doing that just if i play with the battery and the charger with the power button on and off...

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message:
I dont have scope to check pulses...any other way? 
i was post the rest results...

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message:
O-scope helps to catch fast pulses, not needed here.
Multimeter is good enough to see pulsing, or not...

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message:
can you please tell me how do i trigger and how to check pulsing?
thanks

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message:
Use R5115/16 power pads, instead of power button.
A simple wire to pull SMC_ONOFF_L to ground; just a temporary contact, of course.
Check signals reaction at same time...

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message: update...when i was try to check pulses after short the SMC_ONOFF_L to ground, the voltage of PM_PWRBTN_L was 0v without the pulses...after i was disconnect the wire, the fan start , i was put the board back and its turn on,with just charger there is the chaim sound turn on but no fan, just after few min', with battery the fan start immediately,  i was connect all the wires and i was notice that the Touchpad is short, and it didnt turn on again, i was play with reset smc and wait for few min' and it was turn on again with different Touchpad wire...no its stop to turn on again...and dont respond to nothing...i know that if i will play with the board again it will turn on again....i really dont know why...any idea? with reset SMC the fan full speed for 5 sec and dead. can the TouchPad do it?

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message: suddenly its turn on, and after restart i need to wait few min until it turn on again

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message: Fan only starts when the CPU gets very hot, as normal behaviour for this board...

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message: And what can be the reason that it sometimes working and sometimes not? And if i do restart it doesn't turn in, its sound like something from the on/off command

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message:
Machine always turns on, but not always boot into OSX?
Did you try another TP/KB?

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message: No yet, but can it be the solution? I can work with it fine...restart and on/off but if its off for more then 10 min +- its hard to turn it on...need few minutes trying until it turns on

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message:
Always happens that?
Check if starts in SMC bypass mode.

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message: update, after few days that it work fine and even charge the battery, now after the battery run off it dont charging and turn on...with battery just green light stable, without batter, green the orange but not turn on. i was check with used good original battery but the same, bypass SMC just fan on full speed. any idea? ppbus_3gh 13v.

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message:
chgr_agate_div - 6v
chgr_agate - 0v

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message:
13V at PPBUS_G3H???
Change Q7130.
Be sure C7125 is good.

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.

i was change..now is 12.5v , i was try to turn on just after few trying it suddenly turn on, i was play with it 2-3 min then turn in off to see if its will turn on again, but nothing! not turn on again!
i was try before with working full body but the same...its drive me crazy!

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message: Post basic voltages for power on sequence...

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message:
ppbus_g3h = 12.58v
pp3v42_g3h = 3.433v
pp5v_s5 = 5.02v
pp5v_s0 = 0v
pp3v3_s5 = 3.344v
pp3v3_s4 = 0v
pp3v3_s3 = 0v

P3V3S3_EN on U8010 missing

PM_SLP_S4 L 3.4v for few second then 0v

PPVCOMP_S0_CPU = 0v

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message:
"PM_SLP_S4 L 3.4v for few second"
Check all S3 voltages at same time.

Also check if PM_SLP_S3_L pulses too.

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message:
If you get all S3 voltages and PM_SLP_S3_L also goes high (few seconds), check S0 voltages at same time.
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L repeatedly and check the reaction on the voltages.

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message:
"pm_slp_s3_l - 3.4v"
As already said, S0 voltages (controlled by this signal) must appear at same time.

Stable PPBUS_G3H and 3V42_G3H?

suddenly PM_SLP_S4_L apper again 3.4v stable

PPVCC_S0_CPU 1.1V
[B]P1V05S0_VBST 6.1V[/B]
P1V05S0_DRVH 1.0V
P1V05_S0 1.1V

PM_SLP_S4_L 0v 
pm_slp_s3_l - 0v

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message:
You have correct 1V05 voltage.
Why are you surprised for its boost voltage???
Should be 5v higher, exactly what you've got.

Do you use original Magsafe 2 60/85W charger for sure?
Is PM_BATLOW_L steady high?

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message:
PM_BATLOW_L:
when PM_SLP_S4_L 3.4v  its 1.1v 
0v when PM_SLP_S4_L is missing

Do you use original Magsafe 2 60/85W charger for sure?
yes

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message:
PM_BATLOW_L should be steady high.
Reball SMC.

Also check SMC_BC_ACOK.
First, see if board starts with both battery and charger connected.

message:

again PM_SLP_S3 sometime 3.4v and sometime missing...
SMC_BC_ACOK 0v when PM_SLP_S3 IS 0V and when its 3.4v the SMC_BC_ACOK is 5.2v

message:
"SMC_BC_ACOK is 5.2v"
Are you sure???

CHGR_ACIN stable 4V aprox?
If yes, change U7100.
If not, check if CHGR_DCIN is stable.

message:
my mistake: 
 PM_SLP_S3  0v - SMC_BC_ACOK 3.4v
PM_SLP_S3 3.4v - SMC_BC_ACOK 3.4v
CHGR_ACIN 3.9v when PM_SLP_S3 is 3.4v
change u7100?

???????

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message: i didnt do nothing but now board dead...no green/orang light..ppbus 3gh 0.5v

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message:
"CHGR_ACIN 3.9v"
Always???
Should be if, SMC_BC_ACOK is always high (3.4V).

"ppbus 3gh 0.5v"
Now post diode mode to ground at PPBUS_G3H and 3V42_G3H.

Did you make some short between U7100 pins?
Always try to use pins of surrounding components, when you want to measure voltage on a QFN chip...

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message:
"Now post diode mode to ground at.." no charger connected
PPBUS_G3H - 1900+
3V42_G3H - 1900+
change u7100 with new one...
still PPBUS 0.5V

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message:
Do you get 3V42 at least?

Post basic U7100 voltages; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 19, 20, 28.

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message:
"2. 0.5v"
Check diode mode too.

Post D/R7105 voltages.

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message:
"R7105 1-16.5V 2-2.1V"
Burnt, change it.

Don't forget to check diode mode to ground at pin 2/U7100; BEFORE applying power to the board.
If too low (as supposed), change U7100.
Just in case, remove and check C7105 first.

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message:
we back to business..orange light back ppbus is on!
chack again:
PM_SLP_S3 3.3v - SMC_BC_ACOK 3.4v
CHGR_ACIN 3.9v 
i was just changed u7100/r7105/c7105

title: macbook pro 820-4924-a dead green and orange light on,no fan.
message:
TBT volyage not interesting, unless you connect aThunderbolt device.

So you get VCORE and all voltages from pages 61/63?
PLT_RESET_L is high?
